descript.abstract: U.S. States (Generalized) represents the 50 states and the District of Columbia of the United States.
descript.purpose: U.S. States (Generalized) provides demographic information and generalized state boundaries to improve draw performance and be used effectively at a national level.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:3,000,000.

idinfo.useconst:
The data are provided under the Harvard University Site License. These data must be used in compliance with the Site License. This means that the data are only available for Harvard Affiliates for use on Harvard owned computers.
The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. As used herein, "Geodata" shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (e.g. .gif, .jpeg, etc.) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s). Geodata is redistributable with a Value-Added Software Application developed by ESRI Business Partners on a royalty-free basis with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s). Geodata is redistributable without a Value-Added Software Application (i.e., adding the sample data to an existing, [non]commercial data set for redistribution) with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.
Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.
Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.
THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES: (A) THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE NOT FAULT-TOLERANT AND ARE NOT DESIGNED, MANUFACTURED, OR INTENDED FOR USE OR RESALE FOR INSURANCE UNDERWRITING OR WITH CRITICAL HEALTH AND SAFETY OR ONLINE CONTROL EQUIPMENT IN HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENTS THAT REQUIRE FAIL-SAFE PERFORMANCE, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE OPERATION OF NUCLEAR FACILITIES, NAVIGATION OR GUIDANCE (I.E., AIRCRAFT, NAUTICAL VEHICLE, ETC.), OR COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS, AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL, EMERGENCY RESPONSE, TERRORISM PREVENTION OR RESPONSE, LIFE SUPPORT, OR WEAPONS SYSTEMS ("HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES"). ESRI SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES.
(B) TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, LICENSEE AGREES TO INDEMNIFY, DEFEND, AND HOLD ESRI, ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUBCONTRACTORS, LICENSORS, SUCCESSORS, AND ASSIGNS HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL LIABILITY, LOSSES, CLAIMS, EXPENSES (INCLUDING ATTORNEYS' FEES), DEMANDS, OR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH LICENSEE'S USE OR PERMITTING THE USE BY OTHERS OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES. DELIVERY OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A WAIVER OF THE RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS ARTICLE.
Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee.
IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.
Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the ArcUSA 1:25M database, and then generalized. Generalizing reduces positional accuracy and the tolerance was not recorded so the positional accuracy exceeds that of the ArcUSA data set. The positional accuracy of the ArcUSA 1:25M data set is 1792 meters which is based on generalizing-to a tolerance of 500 meters-the 1:2,000,000-scale USGS Digital Line Graph (DLG) source data.

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF1) data is based on the 2000 Census of Population.

citeinfo.title: ESRI Data - Updated Demographics
citeinfo.othercit: Currently provides the POP2010 attribute. In the past has provided the POP2009, POP2008, POP2007, POP2005, POP2004, POP2003, and POP2001 attributes.

citeinfo.origin: United States. National Agricultural Statistics Service
citeinfo.title: 1997 Census of Agriculture; 2007 Census of Agriculture

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

citeinfo.othercit: The farm attributes come from data published by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) based on the 2007 Census of Agriculture. In the past the attributes came from the 1997 Census of Agriculture.

procstep.procdesc:
The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Replaced demographic and agricultural attributes with the latest from 2000 Census SF1, ESRI Data, and 1997 Census of Agriculture. Recreated ArcView GIS legend file (.avl) and ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Copied projection file (.prj).
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted and generalized the features from ArcUSA 1:25M. Added demographic attributes from Summary Tape File-1A (STF-1A) data published by the U.S. Census Bureau based on the 1990 Census of Population. Added farm attributes from data published by the U.S. Census Bureau based on the 1987 Census of Agriculture. Added Pop2000 attribute from ESRI. Converted to North American Datum of 1983 (NAD83) by splitting the United States into-if present: Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands-and the 48 contiguous states (including District of Columbia); converting each to NAD83; then merging them together. Recalculated any attributes based on area. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue? request ExportClean, and created spatial indices.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied the Molokai coastline from U.S. Counties (Generalized). Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced POP2001 with POP2003 from ESRI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created the projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Renamed attribute AREA to SQMI, moved it to the end of the attributes, and rounded its values to the nearest whole number. Replaced attribute POP2003 with POP2004. Added attribute POP04_SQMI and calculated its values.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced attribute POP2004 with POP2005 and attribute POP04_SQMI with POP05_SQMI. Expanded the values for attribute SUB_REGION. Changed POP00_SQMI to display its tenths place. Calculated new values for attributes POP00_SQMI, POP05_SQMI, and SQMI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied 2009 Data Update U.S. States (Generalized) and renamed it. Removed all fields but STATE_NAME. Attached and formatted the fields from Edition 10 U.S. States. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

procstep.procdesc: This layer was originally downloaded from the ESRI Data and Maps and 10 DVD. The file was stored in an SDC (Smart Data Compression) format on the DVD. ArcCatalog 9.3.1 was utilized to export the SDC file into an ArcSDE 9.3.1 database using the "Feature Class to Feature Class" export tool.

enttyp.enttypd: A type of governmental unit that is the primary legal subdivision of the United States. The U.S. Census Bureau treats the District of Columbia as the equivalent of a state for data presentation purposes.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The state name.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The subregion of the United States in which a state is located. The U.S. subregions are as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau, except in this data set New England is classified as a subregion instead of a region.

edom.edomvd: East, North Central area of the United States.
East, South Central area of the United States.
Middle Atlantic area of the United States.
Rocky Mountains area of the United States.
New England area of the United States.
Pacific area of the United States.
South Atlantic area of the United States.
West, North Central area of the United States.
West, South Central area of the United States.

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 2000 population of the state.
The 2010 estimated population of the state.
The 2000 population of the state per square mile.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, Census Bureau; ESRI

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The 2010 estimated population of the state per square mile.

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The number of people identified as White alone in 2000.
The number of people identified as Black or African American alone in 2000.
The number of people identified as American Indian or Alaska Native alone in 2000.
The number of people identified as Asian alone in 2000.
The number of people identified as Native Hawaiian and other Pacific Islander alone in 2000.
The number of people identified as some other race alone in 2000.
The number of people identified as two or more races in 2000.
The number of people identified as Hispanic or Latino in 2000.
The number of males in 2000.
The number of females in 2000.
The number of people 0 to 4 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 5 to 17 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 18 to 21 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 22 to 29 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 30 to 39 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 40 to 49 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 50 to 64 years of age in 2000.
The number of people 65 years of age and over in 2000.
The median age for both sexes in 2000.
The median age for males in 2000.
The median age for females in 2000.
The total number of households in 2000.
The average household size in 2000.
The number of one-person male households in 2000.
The number of one-person female households in 2000.
The number of family households with a married couple and related children under 18 years in 2000.
The number of family households with a married couple and no related children under 18 years in 2000.
The number of family households with a man and related children under 18 years but no wife in 2000.
The number of family households with a woman and related children under 18 years but no husband in 2000.
The number of families in 2000.
The average family size in 2000.
The total number of housing units in 2000.
The number of housing units that are vacant in 2000.
The number of housing units that are occupied by the owner in 2000.
The number of housing units that are occupied by renters in 2000.
The total number of farms in 2007.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

edom.edomvd: Attribute values of -99 are null values (data not available).
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

attr.attrdef: The average farm size in acres in 2007.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

edom.edomvd: Attribute values of -99 are null values (data not available).

attr.attrdef: The average sales of agricultural products per farm, in thousands of dollars, in 2007.

edom.edomvd: Attribute values of -99 are null values (data not available).

attr.attrdef: The area of the state in square miles.

Feature area.
